critical_rules.description: Missing 'Using' block for IDisposable objects (SqlConnection, FileStream, StreamReader, etc.). Resources must be wrapped in Using blocks to ensure proper disposal.
critical_rules.target: New SqlConnection, New FileStream, New StreamReader, New StreamWriter, IDisposable objects

critical_rules.description: Object not properly disposed. Disposable objects created outside Using blocks must call Dispose() or Close() in Finally block.
critical_rules.target: IDisposable objects, Connection objects, Stream objects

critical_rules.description: Empty Catch block that swallows exceptions without any handling or logging. All Catch blocks must contain meaningful error handling.
Catching generic Exception instead of specific exception types. Use specific exceptions like SqlException, IOException, etc.
critical_rules.target: Catch Ex As Exception, Catch blocks

critical_rules.description: Missing logging or error reporting in Catch block. Exceptions must be logged for debugging purposes.

warning_rules.description: Missing Null check before accessing object properties or methods. Check If obj IsNot Nothing before accessing members.
warning_rules.target: Object property access, method calls on nullable objects

warning_rules.description: Unreachable code detected. Code after Return, Exit, or unconditional Throw statements will never execute.
warning_rules.target: Code after Return, Exit Sub, Exit Function, Throw

warning_rules.description: Missing prefix for UI controls. Use standard prefixes: txt (TextBox), btn (Button), lbl (Label), cbo (ComboBox), lst (ListBox), dgv (DataGridView), etc.
Magic number detected. Use named constants (Const) instead of hard-coded numeric values for better maintainability.
warning_rules.target: Numeric literals in code, hard-coded values

warning_rules.description: Unused variable detected. Remove or use declared variables to keep code clean.
Line exceeds 50 characters. Break long lines for better readability.
Function/Sub exceeds 60 lines. Refactor into smaller, focused methods.
